Southfield, MI, 48076-3048
Re: License #: CB630246843
Dear Ms. Lukowski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
6/13/25. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at WayS1@michigan.gov.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance for this individual CAP is as follows: The
agency corrective action plan resulting from the renewal inspection report that was
completed on 5/21/2024 and the CAP was approved on 5/30/2024. The agency
was in violation with rule 400.12203-1-e, financial stability. The agency
2

immediately corrected the non-compliance with a certified financial auditor. There
is no repeat violation with this rule.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed on site with the chief
administrator on 6/12/2025. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported there was one
rules/policies in non-compliance during the last inspection review. She reported
she corrected this non-compliance immediately with a certified financial auditor.
The CA reported there are barriers to licensing compliance with the agency. She
reported the factors that impact efficiency and ease of moving cases forward to
finalization is the applicants continue to struggle with the paperwork phase of the
adoption assessment process and adoptive families continuing to need significant
emotional support and firm guidance throughout the adoption process to identify a
few. The CA reported the agency is using an outline training platform for all
adoptive applicants. She said using this platform helps the agency to be sure that
the information is up to date and accurate for all customers.
Financial Overview:
The agency provided an annual budget and a financial audit by an independent
certified public accountant dated December 31, 2024. There were no issues
noted.
Staff Interviews:
Two staff were interviewed onsite 6/12/2025. Staff reported the agency is a
relatively small agency and everyone gets along fine. Staff reported they are very
supportive of one another.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services. All files were stored securely and there is a cross
shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This is a non-contracted adoption agency and does not require DCWL analyst
participation.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
3
